## Installing and loading R packages


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pacman::p_load(maptools, sf, raster, spatstat, tmap, tidyverse)
```
:::


## Spatial Data Wrangling

# Importing the spatial Data


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
childcare_sf <- st_read("data/ChildCareServices.geojson") %>% st_transform(crs=3414)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Reading layer `ChildCareServices' from data source 
  `C:\j00b00\IS415-GAA\In-class_EX\In-class_Ex03\data\ChildCareServices.geojson' 
  using driver `GeoJSON'
Simple feature collection with 1925 features and 2 fields
Geometry type: POINT
Dimension:     XYZ
Bounding box:  xmin: 103.6878 ymin: 1.247759 xmax: 103.9897 ymax: 1.462134
z_range:       zmin: 0 zmax: 0
Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
mpsz_sf <- st_read(dsn="data", layer="MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Reading layer `MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL' from data source 
  `C:\j00b00\IS415-GAA\In-class_EX\In-class_Ex03\data' using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
Simple feature collection with 323 features and 15 fields
Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 2667.538 ymin: 15748.72 xmax: 56396.44 ymax: 50256.33
Projected CRS: SVY21
```
:::
:::


# Creating coastal outline


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
sg_sf <- mpsz_sf %>% st_union()
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
plot(sg_sf)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](in-class_Ex03_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## Geospatial Data Wragling

### Creating ppp object: sf_method


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
childcare_ppp <- as.ppp(childcare_sf)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
summary(childcare_ppp)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Marked planar point pattern:  1925 points
Average intensity 2.417323e-06 points per square unit

Coordinates are given to 3 decimal places
i.e. rounded to the nearest multiple of 0.001 units

marks are of type 'character'
Summary:
   Length     Class      Mode 
     1925 character character 

Window: rectangle = [11810.03, 45404.24] x [25596.33, 49300.88] units
                    (33590 x 23700 units)
Window area = 796335000 square units
```
:::
:::


### Handling Duplciate data

We can check the duplication in a ***ppp*** object by using the code chuck below.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
any(duplicated(childcare_ppp))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] FALSE
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
childcare_ppp_jit <- rjitter(childcare_ppp,retry=TRUE,nsim=1,drop=TRUE)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
any(duplicated(childcare_ppp_jit))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] FALSE
```
:::
:::


To count the number of co-indicence point, we will use the *multiplicity()* function

### Creating ***owin*** object: sf_method


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
sg_owin <- as.owin(sg_sf)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
plot(sg_owin)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](in-class_Ex03_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-11-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pg <- mpsz_sf %>% filter(PLN_AREA_N == "PUNGGOL")
tm <- mpsz_sf %>% filter(PLN_AREA_N == "TAMPINES")
ck <- mpsz_sf %>% filter(PLN_AREA_N == "CHOA CHU KANG")
jw <- mpsz_sf %>% filter(PLN_AREA_N == "JURONG WEST")
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
par(mfrow=c(2,2))
plot(pg, main = "Ponggol")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](in-class_Ex03_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-13-1.png){width=1536}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
plot(tm, main = "Tampines")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](in-class_Ex03_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-13-2.png){width=1536}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
plot(ck, main = "Choa Chu Kang")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](in-class_Ex03_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-13-3.png){width=1536}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
plot(jw, main = "Jurong West")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](in-class_Ex03_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-13-4.png){width=1536}
:::
:::
